resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: It pleased my most mercifull god yᵉ 24ᵗʰ of October 1621 to sende me my first borne sonne & heyre whoe was borne att my house in greate Sᵗ Bartlemewes London, Christened, Jhon, by his godfathers, Jnᵒ: Lord Sᵗ Jnᵒ: Marquess of Whinchester, & Jnᵒ: Lord Ramsey Earle of Holderness; his godmother was yᵉ Ladye Hobert, yᵉ L. cheife Justice of yᵉ Comon pleas his wife.
resource.chars: It pleased my most mercifull god yᵉ 24ᵗʰ of October 1621 to sende me my first borne sonne & heyre whoe was borne att my house in greate Sᵗ Bartlemewes London, Christened, Jhon, by his godfathers, Jnᵒ: Lord Sᵗ Jnᵒ: Marquess of Whinchester, & Jnᵒ: Lord Ramsey Earle of Holderness; his godmother was yᵉ Ladye Hobert, yᵉ L. cheife Justice of yᵉ Comon pleas his wife.

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M2927.78299,1999.30811l982.94108,12.36404l-30.9101,1468.22961l-1001.48714,-12.36404v207.09765l-1805.14966,-58.72918l43.27414,-1489.86668l1802.05865,12.36404z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":1,"editable":true,"deleteIcon":null,"annotation":null}" id="rough_path_4993d76d-15ba-4b96-bfdf-b0541465aed5" fill-opacity="0" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#00bfff" stroke-width="1" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: In 13 yeares god bleste me wᵗʰ Eight Children & because my life beinge all waise active & not havinge employmeᵗ to my desire I was even torne awaie as it weare from my most deare Spouse (yᵉ joye of my life) for her worth & goodness not to be paralelde, & soe went a noble voyage to Guiana in yᵉ maine continent of America yᵉ 20th of October ·1633·
resource.chars: In 13 yeares god bleste me wᵗʰ Eight Children & because my life beinge all waise active & not havinge employmeᵗ to my desire I was even torne awaie as it weare from my most deare Spouse (yᵉ joye of my life) for her worth & goodness not to be paralelde, & soe went a noble voyage to Guiana in yᵉ maine continent of America yᵉ 20th of October ·1633·

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M2905.56935,3483.52568l988.16973,15.0292l-52.60219,1807.26099l-826.60586,-3.7573l7.5146,195.12207l-1938.76647,-26.3011l-18.7865,-1829.80479l1829.80479,37.57299l3.7573,-187.86497z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":1,"editable":true,"deleteIcon":null,"annotation":null}" id="rough_path_86446b45-b7e5-4dc8-b630-d39a760cfc82" fill-opacity="0" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#00bfff" stroke-width="1" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The daughter of Sʳ Edmond Bell of Beauprey-hall in Norfolke, to whome I was maried yᵉ 4ᵗʰ october anᵒ 1620 after I had yᵉ yeare before made yᵉ toure of England by goeinge Eastward into Scotland & returninge westwarde home wᶜʰ was yᵉ full periode of my travells yᵗ soe havinge seen other cuntryes I might not be esteemed a stranger in my owne.
resource.chars: The daughter of Sʳ Edmond Bell of Beauprey-hall in Norfolke, to whome I was maried yᵉ 4ᵗʰ october anᵒ 1620 after I had yᵉ yeare before made yᵉ toure of England by goeinge Eastward into Scotland & returninge westwarde home wᶜʰ was yᵉ full periode of my travells yᵗ soe havinge seen other cuntryes I might not be esteemed a stranger in my owne.
